metadata.titleEn: ChinaHighNO2: High-resolution and High-quality Ground-level NO2 Dataset for China (2008-2023)
metadata.description:
ChinaHighNO2 is one of the series of long-term, full-coverage, high-resolution, and high-quality datasets of ground-level air pollutants for China (i.e., ChinaHighAirPollutants, CHAP). It is generated from the big data (e.g., ground-based measurements, satellite remote sensing products, atmospheric reanalysis, and model simulations) using artificial intelligence by considering the spatiotemporal heterogeneity of air pollution. This is the big data-derived seamless (spatial coverage = 100%) daily, monthly, and yearly 1 km (i.e., D1K, M1K, and Y1K) ground-level NO2 dataset in China from 2008 to present. Note that this dataset is 10 km before 2019, and improved to 1 km after 2019. This dataset yields a high quality with cross-validation coefficient of determination (CV-R2) values of 0.84 and 0.93, and root-mean-square error (RMSE) values of 7.99 and 4.89 µg m-3 for the daily retrievals for 10 km and 1 km data, respectively. Note that this dataset is continuously updated, and if you want to apply for more data or have any questions, please contact me (Email: weijing_rs@163.com; weijing@umd.edu).
The data file contains four codes (Python, Matlab, IDL and R language) nc2geotiff codes for NC to GeoTiff.
metadata.instructions: File Name: The data is stored in the NetCDF file format, and the file name is CHAP_NO2_ab_yyyymmdd_V1.nc, where a represents time resolution (D represents daily data, M represents monthly data, Y represents annual data), b represents spatial resolution (1K represents 1km), yyyy represents year, mm represents month, and dd represents day. Data reading method: Python, Matlab, IDL, and other programming methods can be used to convert files from NC to TIF. The data coordinate system is WGS-1984, with a background value of 65535.

Feature Specification.Question: What features and characteristics are involved in the creation of a high-resolution ground-level NO2 dataset from 2008 to 2023 in China using artificial intelligence techniques?
Feature Specification.Answer: spatiotemporal heterogeneity, big data sources, ground-based observations, satellite remote sensing products, atmospheric reanalysis, model simulation data, seamless ground-level NO2 data, spatial resolution of 10 km before 2019, spatial resolution of 1 km after 2019, temporal resolution of daily measurements, temporal resolution of monthly measurements, temporal resolution of yearly measurements, accuracy validated through ten-fold cross-validation, R2 of 0.84 for 10 km data, RMSE of 7.99 µg/m3 for 10 km data, R2 of 0.93 for 1 km data, RMSE of 4.89 µg/m3 for 1 km data

Quantification.Question: What is the spatial resolution of the NO2 data collection before and after 2019?

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the consequences of using artificial intelligence to incorporate temporal and spatial heterogeneity in air pollution data collection methods?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using artificial intelligence to incorporate temporal and spatial heterogeneity in air pollution data collection methods results in high-resolution, high-quality ground-level NO2 datasets across China. It allows for seamless data from multiple sources such as ground observations, satellite remote sensing products, atmospheric reanalysis, and model simulations, improving the accuracy and resolution of air quality data. This approach increases the spatial resolution from 10 km to 1 km after 2019, enhancing the dataset's applicability for fine-scale environmental analysis.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to utilize artificial intelligence techniques in generating high-resolution, high-quality ground-level NO2 datasets for China from 2008 to 2023?
Goal Orientation.Answer: Artificial intelligence techniques are crucial for generating high-resolution, high-quality NO2 datasets because they can effectively handle the spatio-temporal heterogeneity of air pollution. By leveraging big data sources such as ground-based observations, satellite remote sensing products, atmospheric reanalysis, and model simulations, AI can produce seamless ground-level NO2 data across China, offering significant improvements in spatial resolution from 10 km before 2019 to 1 km afterwards. This approach ensures high accuracy with a cross-validation R2 of 0.84 and RMSE of 7.99 µg/m3 for 10 km data and an R2 of 0.93 and RMSE of 4.89 µg/m3 for 1 km data.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures and AI technologies are involved in creating a high-resolution NO2 dataset for China, considering the spatio-temporal heterogeneity of air pollution?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The creation of a high-resolution NO2 dataset involves utilizing artificial intelligence technologies to account for the spatio-temporal heterogeneity of air pollution. This process includes leveraging large datasets from sources such as ground-based observations, satellite remote sensing products, atmospheric reanalysis, and model simulations to produce seamless surface NO2 data across China from 2008 to the present. The spatial resolution was 10 km before 2019 and improved to 1 km after 2019. The techniques employed ensure high accuracy, with a cross-validation R2 of 0.84 and RMSE of 7.99 µg/m3 for the 10 km data, and R2 of 0.93 and RMSE of 4.89 µg/m3 for the 1 km data.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements have enabled the seamless production of high-resolution near-surface NO2 datasets across China from 2008 to the present?
Enablement.Answer: The use of artificial intelligence techniques, which consider the spatiotemporal heterogeneity of air pollution, has enabled the seamless production of high-resolution near-surface NO2 datasets across China. This process involves leveraging big data sources such as ground-based observations, satellite remote sensing products, atmospheric reanalysis, and model simulation data.
